DataElement.preferredName: MRI Temporal Position Identifier 12 Byte Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Temporal order of a dynamic or functional set of Images.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Temporal Position Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Timing of the particular order of a dynamic or functional set of images that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field to provide detailed pictures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: Terms used to indicate units of time or other terms associated with time.:Position; the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Terms used to indicate units of time or other terms associated with time.
Position; the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/8/14 - Released as part of caBIG Draft Content review; DICOM content. jc  5/15/08 - created for DICOM and ACRIN DCE-MRI data elements.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: IS: A string of characters representing an Integer in base-10 (decimal), shall contain only the listed characters (0-9, +,-). [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::12:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/9/13 changed data type to number for reuse in CRF Standard. jc  1/6/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
